article_title: Unanswered Health Law Question: So Why Was It Written that Way?
article_text:
What, exactly, did Congress mean when it wrote those four nettlesome words?

Behind the King v. Burwell challenge to the Affordable Care Act was the argument that only health-insurance exchanges “established by the State” could offer subsidies. The Obama administration countered that the phrase was meant to include exchanges run not only by individual states but by the federal government.

The court sided with the...

twitter.description: Even after the Supreme Court upheld health-insurance subsidies in all states, the question remains: Why did Congress use the phrase “established by the State” in the first place?
twitter.creator: @JessBravin

image.alt: The story behind the four words in the #SCOTUS ACA case
